dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMaking code entities such as a Keras script/notebook, \u003cstrong\u003ecloud and\ndistribution ready\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConverting this distribution entity into a \u003cstrong\u003edocker container\u003c/strong\u003e with the\nrequired dependencies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDeploy\u003c/strong\u003e this container at scale and train using TensorFlow distribution\nstrategies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStream logs\u003c/strong\u003e and monitor them on hosted TensorBoard, manage checkpoint\nstorage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, we will use local docker daemon for building and publishing docker\nimages to Google container registry. Images are published to\n\u003ccode\u003egcr.io/your-gcp-project-id\u003c/code\u003e. If you specify \u003ccode\u003edocker_config.image_build_bucket\u003c/code\u003e,\nthen we will use \u003ca href=\"https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eGoogle Cloud build\u003c/a\u003e to\nbuild and publish docker images.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWe use \u003ca href=\"https://cloud.google.com/ai-platform/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eGoogle AI platform\u003c/a\u003e for deploying\ndocker images on GCP.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePlease note that, when \u003ccode\u003eentry_point\u003c/code\u003e argument is specified, all the files in the\nsame directory tree as \u003ccode\u003eentry_point\u003c/code\u003e will be packaged in the docker image\ncreated, along with the \u003ccode\u003eentry_point\u003c/code\u003e file.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ePlease see \u003ccode\u003erun\u003c/code\u003e API documentation for detailed information on the parameters\nand how you can modify the above processes random numbers).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSolution\u003c/strong\u003e: Passing \u003ccode\u003edistribution_strategy='auto'\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003erun\u003c/code\u003e API wraps all of\nyour script in a TF distribution strategy based on the cluster configuration\nprovided. You will see the above error or something similar to it, if for some\nreason an operation is not allowed inside distribution strategy scope. To fix\nthe error, please pass \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e to the \u003ccode\u003edistribution_strategy\u003c/code\u003e param and create a\nstrategy instance as part of your training code as shown in\n\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/tensorflow/cloud/blob/master/src/python/tensorflow_cloud/core/tests/testdata/save_and_load.py\"\u003ethis\u003c/a\u003e\nexample.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDocker image build timeout\u003c/h4\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-docker-image-build-timeout\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Docker image build timeout\" href=\"#docker-image-build-timeout\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eError like\u003c/strong\u003e: requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: ('Connection aborted.',\ntimeout('The write operation timed out'))\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSolution\u003c/strong\u003e: The directory being used as an entry point likely has too much\ndata for the image to successfully build, and there may be extraneous data\nincluded in the build. Using\nthe latest TF nightly build.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSolution\u003c/strong\u003e: If you do not provide \u003ccode\u003edocker_config.parent_image\u003c/code\u003e param, then by\ndefault we use pre-built TF docker images as parent image. If you do not have TF\ninstalled on the environment where \u003ccode\u003erun\u003c/code\u003e is called, then TF docker image for the\n\u003ccode\u003elatest\u003c/code\u003e stable release will be used. Otherwise, the version of the docker image\nwill match the locally installed TF version. However, pre-built TF docker images\naren't available for TF nightlies except for the latest. 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The API call will encompass the following:</p><ol dir="auto"><li>Making code entities such as a Keras script/notebook, <strong>cloud anddistribution ready</strong>.</li><li>Converting this distribution entity into a <strong>docker container</strong> with therequired dependencies.</li><li><strong>Deploy</strong> this container at scale and train using TensorFlow distributionstrategies.</li><li><strong>Stream logs</strong> and monitor them on hosted TensorBoard, manage checkpointstorage.</li></ol><p dir="auto">By default, we will use local docker daemon for building and publishing dockerimages to Google container registry. Images are published to<code>gcr.io/your-gcp-project-id</code>. If you specify <code>docker_config.image_build_bucket</code>,then we will use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/cloud-build" rel="nofollow">Google Cloud build</a> tobuild and publish docker images.</p><p dir="auto">We use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/ai-platform/" rel="nofollow">Google AI platform</a> for deployingdocker images on GCP.</p><p dir="auto">Please note that, when <code>entry_point</code> argument is specified, all the files in thesame directory tree as <code>entry_point</code> will be packaged in the docker imagecreated, along with the <code>entry_point</code> file.</p><p dir="auto">Please see <code>run</code> API documentation for detailed information on the parametersand how you can modify the above processes to suit your needs.</p><div To fixthe error, please pass <code>None</code> to the <code>distribution_strategy</code> param and create astrategy instance as part of your training code as shown in<a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/cloud/blob/master/src/python/tensorflow_cloud/core/tests/testdata/save_and_load.py">this</a>example.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Docker image build timeout</h4><a id="user-content-docker-image-build-timeout" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Docker image build timeout" href="#docker-image-build-timeout"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Error like</strong>: requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: ('Connection aborted.',timeout('The write operation timed out'))</p><p dir="auto"><strong>Solution</strong>: The directory being used as an entry point likely has too muchdata for the image to successfully build, and there may be extraneous dataincluded in the build. Usingthe latest TF nightly build.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>Solution</strong>: If you do not provide <code>docker_config.parent_image</code> param, then bydefault we use pre-built TF docker images as parent image. If you do not have TFinstalled on the environment where <code>run</code> is called, then TF docker image for the<code>latest</code> stable release will be used. Otherwise, the version of the docker imagewill match the locally installed TF version. However, pre-built TF docker imagesaren't available for TF nightlies except for the latest. So, if your local TF isan older nightly version, we upgrade to the latest nightly automatically andraise this warning.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Mixing distribution strategy objects.</h4><a id="user-content-mixing-distribution-strategy-objects" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Mixing distribution strategy objects." href="#mixing-distribution-strategy-objects"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Error like</strong>: RuntimeError: Mixing different tf.distribute.Strategy objects.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>Solution</strong>: Please provide <code>distribution_strategy=None</code> when you already havea distribution strategy defined in your model code. Specifying<code>distribution_strategy'='auto'</code>, will wrap your code in a TensorFlowdistribution strategy.
